intro: Sebertia, commonly known as the African mahogany, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It comprises several species native to tropical Africa, characterized by their ornamental value and ecological significance. The plants typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, clustered flowers with four petals. Sebertia species are often found in moist forest environments and are valued for their durable, aromatic wood. They play an important role in local ecosystems and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
